required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Behavioral Economics Applications to Geriatrics Leveraging EHRs R33 Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Behavioral Economics Applications to Geriatrics Leveraging EHRs R33 Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators will evaluate clinical decision support nudges informed by behavioral science and directed at primary care clinicians. These will be used to reduce commonly misused, and potentially harmful, diagnostic and therapeutic actions that occur in the care of older adults (e.g. overtreatment of type 2 diabetes, misuse of PSA screening, misuse of urine testing in women with nonspecific symptoms or no symptoms.

detailed_description.textblock:
Diagnostic and therapeutic strategies misapplied to older adults can lead to increased morbidity and mortality. Despite recommendations from the American Geriatrics Society for the Choosing Wisely Initiative, there are clear examples where clinicians do not often follow best practices leading to patient harm. These include: (1) testing and treatment for asymptomatic bacteriuria (ASB) in older women, (2) prostate specific antigen (PSA) screening in older men, and (3) aggressive treatment with insulin or oral hypoglycemics for type 2 diabetes.
Clinical decision support nudges, informed by behavioral economics and social psychology and delivered via electronic health records (EHRs), are promising strategies to reduce the misuse of services. Behavioral economics-informed interventions influence conscious and unconscious drivers of decision making, are low cost, and can be incorporated into existing systems.
This randomized controlled trial will evaluate the effects of three clinical decision support nudges on three clinical quality measures, indicators of patient safety, and clinician attitudes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cluster-randomized by primary care clinic using a constrained randomization process.

primary_outcome.description: Measure defined as the presence of a PSA laboratory result in the EHR during the measurement period among men aged 76 years and older at the start of the measurement period with at least one visit during the measurement period with a primary care clinician and who are without a diagnosis or procedure suggesting a history of prostate cancer.

Measure defined as the absence of a diagnostic code for a specific genitourinary sign, symptoms or other potentially relevant indication among instances where a urinalysis and/or urine culture is obtained in the interval 24 hours before to 48 hours after a face-to-face ambulatory care visit by a woman aged 65 years or older with a primary care clinician during the measurement period.

Measure defined as having the most recent hemoglobin A1C during the measurement period of less than 7.0 and insulin or an oral hypoglycemic drug on their active medication list at the end of the measurement period among adults aged 75 years and older with a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of UTI requiring hospital care following clinical decision support exposure
secondary_outcome.description: Emergency department visit or hospitalization for an infection originating from the urinary tract within 28 days of an index visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of UTI requiring hospital care among women 65 and over following an office visit
Rate of hyperglycemia requiring hospital care following clinical decision support exposure
Rate of hyperglycemia requiring hospital care among previously tightly controlled
Rate of poor diabetes control among previously tightly controlled
Rate of hypoglycemia requiring urgent care among previously tightly controlled

other_outcome.description: Measure defined as the presence of a PSA laboratory result in the EHR during the measurement period among men aged 76 years and older at the start of the measurement period with at least one visit during the measurement period with a primary care clinician and who are without a diagnosis or procedure suggesting a history of prostate cancer.

Measure defined as the absence of a diagnostic code for a specific genitourinary sign, symptoms or other potentially relevant indication among instances where a urinalysis and/or urine culture is obtained in the interval 24 hours before to 48 hours after a face-to-face ambulatory care visit by a woman aged 65 years or older with a primary care clinician during the measurement period.

Measure defined as having the most recent hemoglobin A1C during the measurement period of less than 7.0 and insulin or an oral hypoglycemic drug on their active medication list at the end of the measurement period among adults aged 75 years and older with a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus.

Rate of prostate biopsy among men with at least one visit during the measurement period with a primary care clinician and who are without a diagnosis or procedure suggesting a history of prostate cancer at the beginning of the measurement period

Rate of prostate MRI among men with at least one visit during the measurement period with a primary care clinician and who are without a diagnosis or procedure suggesting a history of prostate cancer at the beginning of the measurement period

Rate of prostate cancer diagnosis among men with at least one visit during the measurement period with a primary care clinician and who are without a diagnosis or procedure suggesting a history of prostate cancer at the beginning of the measurement period

other_outcome.measure: PSA screening done by non PCP in men over 76
other_outcome.description: PSA screening done by clinicians in specialties outside of primary care

other_outcome.measure: PSA screening in men aged 55 to 69 and age 70 to 75
Rates of urinalysis and urine culture use in women 65 and older
other_outcome.description: Proportion of all women with one or more visit to an eligible clinic during the prior 12 months receiving urinalysis and/or urine culture

other_outcome.measure: Rate of treatment for antibiotics for UTI in women 65 and older
other_outcome.description: Proportion of all women with one or more visit to an eligible clinic during the prior 12 months receiving antibiotic for confirmed or possible UTI

other_outcome.measure: Dose reduction in insulin, sulfonylurea or meglitinides
other_outcome.description: Proportion of patients 75 years old and older with initial HbA1c <7.0 and treated with insulin, sulfonylurea or meglitinides who have a dose reduction

arm_group.description: Clinicians attributed to clinics in the brief clinician education arm will receive invitation to view an online educational module and be recruited to complete an online survey at baseline and 18 months.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Clinical decision support nudges and brief clinician education
arm_group.description: Clinicians attributed to clinics randomized to the clinical decision support nudges and brief clinician decision support arm will receive clinical decision support within the EHR when conditions meet alert triggering criteria. These clinicians will also receive invitation to view an online educational module and be recruited to complete an online survey at baseline and 18 months.

intervention.description: Clinical decision support nudges delivered within the EHR when conditions meet alert triggering criteria.
intervention.arm_group_label: Clinical decision support nudges and brief clinician education

intervention.description: Clinicians will be invited to view brief education material.
intervention.arm_group_label: Clinical decision support nudges and brief clinician education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Northwestern Medicine primary care clinician who sees patients under department code of a randomized clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Resident physicians will be excluded

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data will not be shared.
